body:
>I have no problem with Alacritty 0.3.3

We've added a lot of default binging for combined modifers, so now you're getting them, however you shouldn't get any of them, since your wm should, idk, capture them (I'm not vary familiar with X11, but I'd expect that) in the mentioned case.

The most interesting part here is that you're saying that you are using `Ctrl + Shift + Right`, `Ctrl + Shift + Left` to trigger it, however I don't see these events in `alacritty --print-events`, the event I see is `Ctrl + Alt + Right`, so these C/D are coming from it.

Do you have some keyboard configuration/remapping, etc?

I have nothing but the default shortcuts on XFCE4, I even removed a few (Ctrl+Alt+ Numbers).

I did a bisection, and the faulty commit seems to be 1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3.

I could not reproduce the error with 0.4.0, I assume I miss-used `cargo install` the first time (I did not use --locked then). So the problem is probably coming from the last version of winit.
@Hugal31 Your original report was from v0.3.3, so you're saying that your issue was on v0.3.3, then now you don't have it on v0.4.0, but after v0.4.0 we reintroduced the problem to you, right?

I had no issue with v0.3.3. However I had problem with 0.4.0, that I cannot reproduce now, I am sorry. I assume I miss-used `cargo install` (which does not use the Cargo.lock by default) back then.
I cannot find a better explanation :(

However I can now reproduce the bug on from commit 1cfb074.
I looked at [the changelog of winit](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md), and it seems the version 0.20.0-alpha6 had a bug, so it might come from here.
You can't repro with v0.3.3 likely because v0.3.3 didn't have bindings for `Ctrl+Shift+Right` and `Ctrl+Shift+Left` at all, but now since v0.4.0 we have plenty of them in alacritty.
Generally your WM shouldn't even forward keys that it already captures itself, so I'm not sure how a winit regression could have caused issues here.

I started receiving workspace switch keys on `xmonad` as well. I'm using `Ctrl-F<N>` to switch workspaces.

`v0.4.0` worked for me while `v0.4.1` started injecting keys like `^[[17;5~` into all alacritty terminals but not `xterm` for comparison. Is there an easy way to check if `xterm` (or an equivalent) also sees these events but swallows them?

Currenlty I'm working it around by injecting empty strings:

```
  # collides with xmonad's desktop switch
  #- { key: F1,       mods: Control, chars: "\x1b[1;5P"                       }
  #- { key: F2,       mods: Control, chars: "\x1b[1;5Q"                       }
  #- { key: F3,       mods: Control, chars: "\x1b[1;5R"                       }
  #...
  - { key: F1,       mods: Control, chars: ""                                }
  - { key: F2,       mods: Control, chars: ""                                }
  - { key: F3,       mods: Control, chars: ""                                }
  ...
```

I've bisected `alacritty` down 1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3  commit:

```
$ git bisect bad
1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3 is the first bad commit
commit 1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3
Author: Christian Duerr <contact@christianduerr.com>
Date:   Sun Jan 5 01:00:50 2020 +0000

    Bump winit to 0.20.0 Alpha 6

    Fixes #3070.
    Fixes #2893.
    Fixes #2877.
    Fixes #2829.
    Fixes #2767.
    Fixes #2271.

 CHANGELOG.md                     |   5 +
 Cargo.lock                       | 167 ++++++++++++++++---------------
 Cargo.toml                       |   1 +
 alacritty/Cargo.toml             |   2 +-
 alacritty/src/config/bindings.rs | 209 ++++++++++++++++-----------------------
 alacritty/src/event.rs           |  24 ++---
 alacritty/src/input.rs           | 136 ++++++++++++-------------
 alacritty/src/url.rs             |   2 +-
 8 files changed, 261 insertions(+), 285 deletions(-)
```

Could it be that `winit` (or some dependency) can somehow bypass `WM` and listens to raw events?

@trofi Could you please provide us with `alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > out.txt` from the **bad** commit you've mentioned and from the one before it? Please, try to do exactly the same things on your system during both repro and send both logs as txt files here.

You should ~do the following:
- run `alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > out.txt`
- focus it if it's not focused
- focus some workspace with your hotkey that pastes some chars in alacritty
- focus back to workspace with alacritty
- close it with system hotkey

I've just noticed that it looks like `is_synthetic` is always true when a key combination like this is pressed. So it might be possible that it's recommended to ignore events with `is_synthetic` set to true.

@Osspial can you maybe give some recommendations on handling of synthetic events? Should these usually be ignored?

> @trofi Could you please provide us with `alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > out.txt` from the **bad** commit you've mentioned and from the one before it? Please, try to do exactly the same things on your system during both repro and send both logs as txt files here.
> 
> You should ~do the following:
>     * run `alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > out.txt`
>     * focus it if it's not focused
>     * focus some workspace with your hotkey that pastes some chars in alacritty
>     * focus back to workspace with alacritty
>     * close it with system hotkey

Done the following:

```
$ git checkout 1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3 && cargo build && target/debug/alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > first-bad-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3.txt
# Ctrl-F7, Ctrl-F6, observed garbage, Win4-Shift-C (close)

$ git checkout 1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3^ && cargo build && target/debug/alacritty --config-file /dev/null --print-events > last-good-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3^.txt
# Ctrl-F7, Ctrl-F6, observed no garbage, Win4-Shift-C (close)
```

Attached both files:
- [first-bad-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3.txt](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/4051767/first-bad-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3.txt)
- [last-good-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3^.txt](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/4051768/last-good-1cfb0740bc530da3162292bbf682a234240f26a3.txt)

@trofi I'm a bit sorry, right now. It turned out that using `--config-file /dev/null` could break event logging for whatever reason, so your logs are bit strange. (I've just rechecked it on my system). Could you do the following but with some empty file. Like `touch empty.txt` and then `alacritty --print-events --config-file empty.txt`?

Ok, it turned out that we forgot about "new winit feature", which sends synthetic events in some cases, which leads to the behavior you see on this issue. So we're likely should just ignore them, however I we should wait on this comment to be replied https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/3109#issuecomment-573470189 .

It's not about combination though, it's all events which could be kind of related to your window, but not direclty...
@trofi yeah, it's related. I think it's safe for alacritty to just ignore them entirey, but we'd agreed on IRC that hearing from winit folks before taking action is better here.
